snippet: The 88-year-old man was charged with 25 counts of murder in a 1944 massacre in France, while the murder case of another former SS member was dropped.
abstract: German officials in Cologne charge 88-year-old former member of an SS armored division that slaughtered 642 villagers in France in 1944 with 25 counts of murder, while German court in another city drops the case against a 92-year-old former SS member charged with killing a Dutch resistance fighter during World War II; cases are apparently a result of a poster campaign in Germany by the Simon Wiesenthal Center.
lead_paragraph: The 88-year-old man was charged with 25 counts of murder in a 1944 massacre in France, while the murder case of another former SS member was dropped.

headline.main: Germany Charges Former SS Member in Wartime Killings
headline.print_headline: Germany Charges Former SS Member in Wartime Murders

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
